User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: k how old r u exactly lol

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: How often do you play video games (computer, console, arcade)?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: What genre of video game do you play the most (first person shooter, racing, role playing, stratergy, massively multiplayer online role playing game, adventure. Etc etc )

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: Do you play multiplayer more than single player?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: When you play multiplayer games do you commutate with other players?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: When you play a video game do you do things that would be against the law or unethical in the real world even when its not necessary to progress in the game? If so then state reason in which you feel compelled to do so.

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Message.Text: Yes, as a method of exploration and role playing, to gain an understanding of what it is like to do something out of my usual habits or what is ethical in the real world. Most often It's also a lot of fun to see how hard you can push the confines of the world of the game, for example, killing an entire town in Oblivion with my bare hands, just to see what it will be like at later point in time.

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: What aspects of video games do you find the most important (graphics, story, gameplay)?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Message.Text: Gameplay and direct interaction between controls and player movement. Take a basic example, Super Mario Bros, 4 directions, two buttons, but it still manages to capture the feelings of inertia and phyiscs better than of the mainstream successes. If a game is fun to run and walk around the environment, then it speaks highly of the effort put into its design and it's something that personally stands

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: Do you think that video games affect the way people interact?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
- James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Message.Text: They can, I dont think that it can turn regular people into homicidal manics for playing to much GTA, but it can create great social circumstances between gamers that may not have ever really had that sort of situation to be in. Lan's and DS wifi for example. They can also change the way people communicate online, if you deem that the real world

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Message.Text: But that is generally an issue with animinosity of the internet, as apposed to the game, the game merely acts as a great perpetuator of peoples already different behaviour.

User.FriendlyName: - James O'

Text.Style: font-family:Tempus Sans ITC; font-weight:bold; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

Message.Text: What is your favorite video game?

User.FriendlyName: - James O'
